creator: lemval@kabelfoon.nl
text:
When specifying a manifest in the jar task, the classpath is broken up.
This seems to cause problems on IBM's AIX (using IBM JDK). Besides, it
is strangely cut off.

====== Generated =====
Manifest-Version: 1.0
Created-By: Ant 1.4.1
Class-Path: xerces.jar log4j.jar mosel.jar fbclasses.jar castor-xml.ja
 r jakarta-regexp-1.2.jar

=====  Original ====== (class-path on a single line)
Manifest-Version: 1.0
Class-Path: xerces.jar log4j.jar mosel.jar fbclasses.jar castor-xml.jar jakarta-
regexp-1.2.jar version.jar

Please read this document, in particular the section on line length
http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.4/docs/guide/jar/jar.html#Notes%20on%20Manifest%20and%20Signature%20Files

I believe Ant is conforming to this spec. What problems is this causing on the
IBM JDK. In particular, what version of Java is it?
creator: conor@apache.org
lemval@kabelfoon.nl
text:
My mistake. This is not a bug.
Problem was caused by case-sensitivity in the classpath (which 
ofcourse :{ only occurred in the manifests with long (wrapped) lines as coincidence).
